model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Hi there, I was wondering if you'd like to join me for lunch on Tuesday at the school cafeteria.
Oh, sure. Thanks for the invitation. What time were you thinking?
Noon works for me. Is that okay with you?
Yeah, that works for me. Thanks for asking me to join you.
No problem, it'll be great to catch up. Hey, do you remember when we talked about me being irresponsible a few years ago?
Yeah, I remember that conversation. What about it?
Well, I wanted to share some good news with you. I've been recently promoted to the night shift and have been doing a great job. I think I've come a long way since those days.
That's awesome, congratulations! I'm proud of you and all the hard work you've put in. You've definitely grown and matured in the workplace.
Thank you, I appreciate that. But I have to admit, I'm still a bit nervous about being wrong. Remember when we talked about my constantly questioning myself and second-guessing my decisions?
Yeah, I remember that. Is there anything specific that's been bothering you?
Not really, it's just a general feeling of uncertainty at times. But hey, speaking of uncertainty, do you remember when we talked about my love for singing a while ago?
Yes, I do. How's that been going for you?
It's actually been going really well. I recently auditioned for a major singing competition and was chosen as a finalist.
Wow, that's amazing! Congratulations, I had no idea you were still pursuing singing.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Singing competition success', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A shares excitement about reaching the final round of a singing competition.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: I'm so excited! I made it to the final round of the singing competition! ### Co-workers B: That's amazing news, Co-workers A! Congratulations! ### Co-workers A: Thank you! I've been working so hard for this. It's always been a dream of mine to be a singer. ### Co-workers B: I remember you telling me about your passion for singing a few years ago. You've come a long way since then. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, I've been taking lessons and performing in local shows. It's been a great way to practice and improve my skills. ### Co-workers B: It's clear that all your hard work has paid off. I'm sure you'll do great in the final round! ### Co-workers A: Thanks, but I'm still nervous. I don't want to mess up. ### Co-workers B: I remember you mentioning that you were always worried about being wrong. But you're a reliable journalist and now a finalist in a singing competition. You have what it takes to succeed. ### Co-workers A: You're right. I need to have more confidence in myself. ### Co-workers B: Exactly. Believe in yourself and trust that you've prepared enough for this. Good luck in the final round, Co-workers A! I can't wait to see you perform.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Support and encouragement', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers B reassures Co-workers A about handling new responsibilities and encourages self-belief.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Okay, thanks for the advice. You know, speaking of mistakes, I still feel terrible about what happened a few years ago with your arrest. ### Co-workers B: It's okay, I've moved on from that. But I do appreciate your concern. ### Co-workers A: I just wish I had thought about how my actions would affect you. I've been trying to be more responsible and considerate since then. ### Co-workers B: I've noticed the change in you, and I appreciate it. We all make mistakes, but it's important to take responsibility for our actions and try to do better.' }
```
